get.description: You can use this API to download the count of items shortlisted for two-day shipping for a specific rule defined by ruleId and ruleStatus

parameters.name: ruleId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of the rule created for custom rule assortment.

parameters.name: ruleStatus
parameters.description: Status of the rule post the rule creation. Allowed values are Active, Inactive, Submitted.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

parameters.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
parameters.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

parameters.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
parameters.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

parameters.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
parameters.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID

parameters.name: WM_SVC.NAME
parameters.description: Walmart Service Name

put.description: This API helps you define coverage areas for your items that are held outside of the fulfillment centers defined by your shipNode management API's.

parameters.name: Authorization
parameters.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

parameters.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
parameters.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

parameters.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
parameters.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

parameters.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID

parameters.description: Walmart Service Name

ruleId.description: Unique identifier of the rule created for custom rule assortment.

ruleStatus.description: Status of the rule post the rule creation. Allowed values are Active, Inactive, Submitted.

actions.description: Defines the two day state coverage areas.

items.description: Defines the two day state coverage areas.

conditions.description: Seller creates conditions while defining the custom rule assortment.There are three condition which a seller can use : subCategories, price, weight.

name.description: Name of the rule created for custom rule assortment.

operator.description: Seller uses operator while defining conditions in the rule. Operators allowed for condition price and weight: EQUALS, GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN,GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUALS,LESS_THAN_OR_EQUALS. and for condition subcategories : IN .

value.description: Values for each condition. Value can be a comma separated strings for subcategories and numerical value for price and weight.

items.description: Seller creates conditions while defining the custom rule assortment.There are three condition which a seller can use : subCategories, price, weight.

description.description: Description of the rule created for custom rule assortment.

name.description: Name of the rule created for custom rule assortment.

priority.description: Priority of the rule created for custom rule assortment.

ruleId.description: Unique identifier of the rule created for custom rule assortment.

ruleStatus.description: Status of the rule post the rule creation. Allowed values are Active, Inactive, Submitted.

skuProcessingStatus.description: When the rule gets activated, skuProcessingStatus represents the state of all items being processed for two-day. The two values for skuProcessingStatus are Processing and Completed.

ruleAction.description: Defines the two day state coverage areas.

post.description: This API is used to create a rule by selecting any combination of conditions for Sub-category, Price and Weight.

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item. This will be used by the seller in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters in the sku needing encoding are: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', as well as '%' itself. Other characters don't need to be encoded.

feedId.description: A unique ID, returned from the Create Override Exception API, used for tracking a feed file

post.description: This API is used if any SKU is required to be removed from Two-day delivery settings

skuProcessingStatus.description: When the rule gets activated, skuProcessingStatus represents the state of all items being processed for two-day. The two values for skuProcessingStatus are Processing and Completed.

name.description: Name of the rule created for custom rule assortment.

operator.description: Seller uses operator while defining conditions in the rule. Operators allowed for condition price and weight: EQUALS, GREATER_THAN, LESS_THAN,GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUALS,LESS_THAN_OR_EQUALS. and for condition subcategories : IN .

value.description: Values for each condition. Value can be a comma separated strings for subcategories and numerical value for price and weight.

items.description: Seller creates conditions while defining the custom rule assortment.There are three condition which a seller can use : subCategories, price, weight.

description.description: Description of the rule created for custom rule assortment.

name.description: Name of the rule created for custom rule assortment.

priority.description: Priority of the rule created for custom rule assortment.

feedId.description: A unique ID, returned from the Create Override Exception API, used for tracking a feed file

sku.description: An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item. This will be used by the seller in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters in the sku needing encoding are: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', as well as '%' itself. Other characters don't need to be encoded.

An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item. This will be used by the seller in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters in the sku needing encoding are: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', as well as '%' itself. Other characters don't need to be encoded.

An arbitrary alphanumeric unique ID, specified by the seller, which identifies each item. This will be used by the seller in the XSD file to refer to each item. Special characters in the sku needing encoding are: ':', '/', '?', '#', '[', ']', '@', '!', '$', '&', "'", '(', ')', '*', '+', ',', ';', '=', as well as '%' itself. Other characters don't need to be encoded.

authorization.name: Authorization
authorization.description: Basic authorization header. Base 64 encodes the Client ID and Client Secret retrieved in step two of the integration steps.

accessToken.name: WM_SEC.ACCESS_TOKEN
accessToken.description: The access token retrieved in the Token API call

channelType.name: WM_CONSUMER.CHANNEL.TYPE
channelType.description: A unique ID to track the consumer request by channel. Use the Consumer Channel Type received during onboarding

correlationId.name: WM_QOS.CORRELATION_ID
correlationId.description: A unique ID which identifies each API call and used to track and debug issues; use a random generated GUID for this ID
